questions.text: Which of the following development stacks is not supported out of the box for Elastic Beanstalk?
Which of the following development stacks is not supported out of the box for Elastic Beanstalk?
answers: Apache HTTP Server for Python Applications

questions.text: True or False. RDS is the only database solution you can use with Elastic Beanstalk.
True or False. Besides the resources provisioned in Elastic Beanstalk, you must also pay a small fee for the provisioning of the service.

You are running a Ruby application using AWS Elastic Beanstalk. You have managed platform updates enabled. A coworker of yours is concerned that when a patch is released, there maybe an outage in your application. Which of the following will happen when the patch is released?
answers: Elastic Beanstalk will spin up a new fleet of EC2 instances and wait until the instances pass a health check until terminating the old instances
Elastic Beanstalk will patch the existing EC2 instances one at a time so that there is no downtime
There will be a small outage, but it will be during a maintenance window that you provide
correctAnswers: Elastic Beanstalk will spin up a new fleet of EC2 instances and wait until the instances pass a health check until terminating the old instances

questions.text: You created a MySQL RDS instance via Elastic Beanstalk along with a Node.js application. When you delete the application, will the database be deleted?
